page.title: 18ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH, BLAGDON
page.content: There have been{four churches}in Blagdon before this one. Others collapsed because graves were under the walls.It was rebuilt in{1913. There are three altars each with a cross on top of it or behind it.The altars are always to the east of most churches, but in modern churches it is in the middle.To the left of the main altar is the{Chapel of the Good {Shepherd,}so called because there is a statue of Jesus carrying a stray lamb home.There are ten rows of pews and five aisles. There is an old{Norman {font}where babies are Christened. The Rector is the Rev.C.Hadley and the organist/choirmaster is Mr. Wood. I am one of the Head Choristers. We boys wear surplices,cassocks and ruffs but the men don't wear ruffs. Ladies and girls wear red coats with white cuffs and tassels.
